name: Frayed Knights: The Skull of S'makh-Daon
description: Frayed Knights: The Skull of S'makh-Daon is a 3D indie computer RPG for Windows featuring turn-based combat, old-school sensibilities, and a story of high adventure and comedy. In a world of jaded heroes and veteran adventurers, you play a team of misfits.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Better Processor: 1.2 gHz CPU Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: OpenGL + Compatible 3D Card Storage: 400 MB available space Sound Card: Windows Sound
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Better Processor: 1.2 gHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: OpenGL + Compatible 3D Card Storage: 400 MB available space Sound Card: Windows Sound

reviews.review_text: A surprisingly deep dungeon-crawler, a-la Wizardry, with humorous writing and tons of quests. It's a bit dated, but if you're someone who likes old-school gameplay with a more modern spin, then you'll enjoy this game. Grab it when it's on sale.

Genuinely funny dialogue and an interesting combat system let down by: - occasional (apparently) random encounters - Drama star system designed to prevent save scumming also misses the point of saving for reasons *other* than save scumming. In fixing one problem, they created another. - Seems to be deliberately designed to push you back to town on a regular basis - The town is... basically pretty boring. Takes too long to wander around it compared to the amount of stuff to do. - NPCs that are nowhere near as interesting as the protagonist PCs - The effects of many of the perks & upgrades are not well explained. - The graphics are about on par with Might & Magic 6-8, which is to say mediocre by late 90s standards. I don't actually mind this much, but if you want eye candy look elsewhere.
